article: Markita Andrews became a great salesgirl when she discovered, at age 13, the secret of selling. It _ with desire. For Markita and her mother, who worked 42 _ a waitress in New York after her husband left them when Markita was eight, their _ was to travel the globe. "I'll work hard to make enough money to send you to 44 _ ," her mother said one day. "You'll go to college and when you 45 _ , you'll make enough money to take you and me around the world. Okay?" So at age 13 when Markita 46 _ in her Girl Scout magazine that the scout who sold the most cookies would _ an all-expenses-paid trip for two around the world, she _ to sell all the Girl Scout cookies she could----more Girl Scout cookies than anyone in the world, ever. But desire alone is not _ . To make her dream come true, Markita knew she needed a plan. Her aunt _ . "When you are doing business, dress like you are doing business. 51 _ your Girl Scout uniform. Always smile, whether they buy or not, always be 52 _ . And don't ask them to buy your cookies; ask them to 53 _ ." Lots of other Scouts may have _ that trip around the world. But only Markita went off in her uniform each day after _ . "Hi, I have a dream. I'm earning a trip around the world for me and my mom by selling Girl Scout cookies," she'd say _ the door. "Would you like to invest in one dozen or two dozen boxes of cookies?" Markita _ 3,526 boxes of Girl Scout cookies that year and won her trip around the world. Markita is not smarter than thousands of other people. The _ is that Markita had discovered the secret of selling: Ask, Ask, Ask! Many people fail before they _ begin because they fail to ask for what they want. The fear of rejection leads many of us to reject ourselves and our dreams.
